intro: Orthodanum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf orthodanum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along its stem. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
